messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM The variable doesn't refer to "Read", but the text does. If we want to define another type of lack-of-progress in pkg io in the future, does this variable prevent that? I don't care much. Just pointing it out. I don't think the io package will grow too much. On Thu, Apr 18, 2013 at 5:22 PM, wrote: > Reviewers: golang-dev1, > > Message: > Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, > > I'd like you to review this change to > https://code.google.com/p/go/ > > > Description: > doc/go1.1.html: document io.ErrNoProgress > > Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.**com/8833050/ > > Affected files: > M doc/go1.1.html > > > Index: doc/go1.1.html > ==============================**==============================**======= > --- a/doc/go1.1.html > +++ b/doc/go1.1.html > @@ -832,6 +832,8 @@ > The io package now exports the > <**code>io.ByteWriter interface > to capture the common > functionality of writing a byte at a time. > +It also exports a new error, ** > ErrNoProgress**, > +used to indicate a Read implementation is looping without > delivering data. > > >
  • > > > -- > > ---You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google > Groups "golang-dev" group. > To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an > email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@**googlegroups.com > . > For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/**groups/opt_out > . > > >

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=1a61d674a908 ***

doc/go1.1.html: document io.ErrNoProgress

R=golang-dev, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/8833050
